snippet: A carbon tax is an opportunity to reduce existing taxes, clean up the environment and increase personal freedom and energy security.
abstract: Editorial by environmental economist Yoram Bauman and Prof Shi-Ling Hsu praises British Columbia's progressive carbon tax, which was recently increased from $25 to $30 per metric ton of carbon dioxide, making it more expensive to pollute; notes that carbon tax is used to reduce taxes for individuals and businesses, and has already lowered the region's corporate income tax rate to 10 percent to 12 percent; calls on the United States to introduce a similar measure.

byline.original: By YORAM BAUMAN and SHI-LING HSU

lead_paragraph: A carbon tax is an opportunity to reduce existing taxes, clean up the environment and increase personal freedom and energy security.

headline.seo: A Carbon Tax, Sensible for All
headline.main: The Most Sensible Tax of All
headline.print_headline: The Most Sensible Tax of All
